revised_title: The Formation of Crystals and the Role of Nitrous Exhalations
tldr: The author, P. Francisco Lana, observed the formation of crystals in a specific location in Italy and concluded that nitrous exhalations played a role in their formation. He also noted that these exhalations could hinder vegetation and coagulate dew, leading to the creation of the crystals. Lana supported his theory by extracting a salt with the taste and figure of niter from the soil, which had a similar crystal structure to the observed formations.
